title: "usertagasdir" option in Filename section does not work correctly
body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Did you read FAQ section in [readme.md](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/blob/master/readme.md)?
* [x] Did you test with the latest [releases](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/releases "latest releases") or [commit](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/commits/master "latest commit") ?
* [x] Did you search for existing issues in [Issues](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/issues)?

### Description

"usertagasdir" option in Filename section does not work correctly.
it creates folders under previous tag folder which should created at root dir.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. set "usetagsasdir" option to "True" in "Filename" section, "config.ini" 
2. create tags.txt, multiple tags separated by new line,

ex>
白上フブキ
チノ
ユニ

3. run PixivUtil2 as 7. tags list mode.

**Expected behavior:** tag named folders should created at root dir.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20253131/103768244-83e9f900-5065-11eb-8a7a-879ea3927135.png)


**Actual behavior:** tag named folders created under previous tag folders
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20253131/103768313-9a905000-5065-11eb-9739-9c03aa2a1d71.png)


### Versions

20201211-beta-3

title: GIF only created from second half of Ugoira
body:
### Prerequisites

* [x ] Did you read FAQ section in [readme.md](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/blob/master/readme.md)?
* [x ] Did you test with the latest [releases](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/releases "latest releases") or [commit](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/commits/master "latest commit") ?
* [x] Did you search for existing issues in [Issues](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/issues)?

### Description

Ugoira is composed of two halves (120 frames total)
PixivUtil2 with default settings seems to only create a GIF from the second half

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download individual gallery (NSFW) https://www.pixiv.net/en/artworks/86401819
2. View zip (120 frames)
3. View gif (60 frames, the second half)

**Expected behavior:** The GIF should contain the full 120 frames, or if it's specified in the ugoira (not sure if Pixiv did something like this), 2 GIFs of 60 frames

**Actual behavior:** The GIF only has the second half of the ugoira

### Versions
v20201207-beta1

You can get this information from executing `PixivUtil2.py --help`.
Latest version available in https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/releases

title: After KeyError('isAdContainer') is solved, Error at process_tag_list:() occurs.
body:
### Prerequisites

* [X] Did you read FAQ section in [readme.md](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/blob/master/readme.md)?
* [X] Did you test with the latest [releases](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/releases "latest releases") or [commit](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/commits/master "latest commit") ?
* [X] Did you search for existing issues in [Issues](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/issues)?


### Description
When I attempt to download an image using a tag, the error below occurs.

Unknown Error: (<class 'AttributeError'>, AttributeError("'NoneType' object has no attribute 'loadConfig'",), <traceback object at 0x036DE868>)

This error occurs only in commands that use tags (like input 3, 7).

If I enter more than 2 tags separated by spaces, an additional line of error message will be added.

Error at process_tag_list(): (<class 'AttributeError'>, AttributeError("'NoneType' object has no attribute 'loadConfig'",), <traceback object at 0x03743708>)
Unknown Error: (<class 'AttributeError'>, AttributeError("'NoneType' object has no attribute 'loadConfig'",), <traceback object at 0x036DE868>)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Input 3 or 7(If input 7, you will prepare taglist.txt file.)
2. I input 3
3. Input 'tags'
4. Input 'Bookmark Count'. I left it blank.
5. Input 'Use Partial Match'. I input 'y'.
6. Input 'Oldest first'. I input 'y'.
7. Input 'Start Page'. I letf it default.
8. Input 'End Page'. I letf it default.
9. Input 'Start Date'. I input '2020-12-12'.
10. Input 'End Date'. I input '2020-12-05'.
11. Input 'Search type'. I input 'a'.

12. Unknown Error: (<class 'AttributeError'>, AttributeError("'NoneType' object has no attribute 'loadConfig'",), <traceback object at 0x036DE868>)
traceback object's hexcode is change every attempt. 

### Versions
pixivutil20201211-beta2


I would like to attach a log file when an error occurs, but this error simply shuts down the program without leaving any logs. (pixivutil.log.n file contains only information about the download history. )
What action should I take?

title: [Feature Request] More filters
body:
Hi,

In much the same vein as there are options for maximum and minimum file-size, can we have more options on which files to include/exclude? For example:

A setting to disable downloading ugoira, 
or exclude .jpg file downloading, 
or works before/after a certain cutoff date. 

Please implement these however they make sense to you, or whatever is easiest.

Much love,

title: Can't download Ugoiras when "downloadresized" is active
body:
### Prerequisites

* [*] Did you read FAQ section?
* [*] Did you test with the latest [releases](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/releases "latest releases") or [commit](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/commits/master "latest commit") ?

### Description

The option of allowing to download the "master" version of the images works perfectly in normal cases, but when it tries to download an Ugoira while this option is set to True, it can't download it and skip to the next image; provably because the Ugoira don't have "master" versions (I guess). And yes, this don't happen if I desactive the "downloadresized" option.

### Steps to Reproduce

Trying to download an Ugoira while the "downloadresized" option is still active (or True), either individually (by image_id) or by downloading an entire gallery (by member_id), or any other option.

**Expected behavior:** Download the pack of images and then create the Ugoira

**Actual behavior:** The program can't find the URL of the Ugoira, and then fail to download it:
Image URL : https://tc-pximg01.techorus-cdn.com/img-zip-ugoira/img/2020/03/04/02/40/34/79880686_ugoira1920x1080.zip_ugoira600x600.zip
Filename  : C:\Users\Jonatan\Downloads\Programs\pixivutil20200228\ばっさ (3320140)\79880686_ugoira1920x1080 - 歌う栞桜さん.zip_ugoira600x600
Checking local filename... Getting remote filesize...
Using Referer: https://www.pixiv.net/artworks/79880686
        No file size information!
Remote filesize = -1 B (-1 Bytes)
Start downloading... Using Referer: https://www.pixiv.net/artworks/79880686
[download_image()] HTTP Error: HTTP Error 404: Not Found at https://tc-pximg01.techorus-cdn.com/img-zip-ugoira/img/2020/03/04/02/40/34/79880686_ugoira1920x1080.zip_ugoira600x600.zip
Image url not found/failed to download: 79880686

### Versions

This happen obviously in the latest version (20200228) because this one added the "downloadresized" option

title: Crash on password protected zip
body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Did you read FAQ section?
* [x] Did you test with the latest [releases](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/releases "latest releases") or [commit](https://github.com/Nandaka/PixivUtil2/commits/master "latest commit") ?
Used latest release. See version below

### Description

Got error that zip file is encrypted and that an image can't be extracted.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Enable image verification in the config.ini
2. Download zip file that is encrypted with a password (f1 mode used, fanbox)

**Expected behavior:**

Zip file to remain intact, or images to be extracted. Download

**Actual behavior:**

Crashes as images inside the zip can't be accessed without a password.

Not sure why nobody else raises this, maybe it's because of the running environment?

title: Ugoira-to-WebM conversion fails on the last frame
body:
There's a [long-standing bug using ffmpeg](https://trac.ffmpeg.org/ticket/6128) where it doesn't honor the duration of the last frame when using the concat demuxer. What this means is the last frame is usually displayed for much shorter then specified in the concat file.

Looking at the comments and some [stackexchange posts](https://video.stackexchange.com/questions/20588/ffmpeg-flash-frames-last-still-image-in-concat-sequence), there's a fix. Basically you just repeat an extra `file` directive of the last frame after the last `duration`, so something like
```
file path/to/001.png
duration 5
file path/to/002.png
duration 7
```
becomes
```
file path/to/001.png
duration 5
file path/to/002.png
duration 7
file path/to/002.png
```

This is also the fix listed in the [FFMPEG wiki](https://trac.ffmpeg.org/wiki/Slideshow#Concatdemuxer).

In the `ugoira2webm` function, it looks like you need to change
```
        for i in frames:
            ffconcat += "file " + i['file'] + '\n'
            ffconcat += "duration " + str(float(i['delay']) / 1000) + '\n'

        with open(d + "/i.ffconcat", "w") as f:
            f.write(ffconcat)
```
into
```
        for i in frames:
            ffconcat += "file " + i['file'] + '\n'
            ffconcat += "duration " + str(float(i['delay']) / 1000) + '\n'

        ffconcat += "file " + frames[-1]['file'] + '\n'

        with open(d + "/i.ffconcat", "w") as f:
            f.write(ffconcat)
```

title: Have there been any recent changes to the "file exist" mechanic or is there an issue somewhere?
body:
Hello

I am not an expert but just an user, but I noticed in the last few days that whenever I add a new id and folder to list.txt it keeps constantly rechecking the files in the new folders every time i process the list. Before the behavior was that it would check the first time I added a new id and folder and give me a "file exist" message, the next time it would pass them just as every file that has been downloaded before and registered in the DB as downloaded. 

Suddenly any new folder that I added recently gets rechecked every time I run the list, and I get the "file exists" message every time as well. I do not know how long this has been going on but it is fairly recent. Normally it took about 3.5 to 4 hours the process the list, of course the time gets longer the more ids I add, but suddenly I takes 6 or more hours since the program keeps rechecking the new folders every time. I been adding new ids and folders to the list this way since the beginning and any older stuff I added to the list are being processed normally. I wonder if this new behavior it deliberate and if so is there any setting I have to change to make it behave like before. 

Please note that I have it set to only go back 3 pages when I process the list.txt, any user with more pages I first download completely and then just add them to the list later so it only rechecks 3 pages every time but it still takes along time.

title: caption class has changed
body:
With the new caption translation feature, the caption class has changed:

```
diff --git a/PixivModel.py b/PixivModel.py
index 23cfcaa..224aa8a 100644
--- a/PixivModel.py
+++ b/PixivModel.py
@@ -373,7 +373,8 @@ class PixivImage:
                 self.imageTitle = tempTitle.string
                 break

-        descriptionPara = page.findAll("p", attrs={'class': 'caption'})
+        descriptionPara = page.findAll("p", attrs={'class': 'caption js-work-caption-original'})
         for tempCaption in descriptionPara:
             if tempCaption is None or tempCaption.text is None:
                 continue
```

title: Single/Stand-alone images categorized as "manga" aren't saved/are ignored.
body:
Usually, uploads categorized as "manga" have multiple images. Those obviously download easily - no issues. 

However, recently I realized that single images that an artist categorizes as "manga" will open differently from regular stand-alone images. Instead of opening the full-size image within the same page, it will open it in another tab - as it would when you want to see the full-size version of an image within a series of images categorized as "manga." 

That's not a problem in itself, but it's probably important regarding -why- the problem I'm going to point out is occurring. Like the post's/thread's title says, these images aren't saved. At all. 

Anyone with a similar issue? Even though I'm sure this is probably non-unique/not just on my side. Inwhichcasehopingforafixsoon!

title: Can't use tabs before %root% in list.txt
body:
So this is the smallest of bugs, but I use tabs to separate member IDs from folders in list.txt.  If I do:

12345(tab)(tab)D:\

Then it's fine.  But if I do any variation on 

12345(tab)(tab)%root%

an error is thrown when it gets parsed.

This popped up after %root% was fixed in #191

title: Question on formating of rootdirectory
body:
Thanks for help in advance, I'm pretty sure this is my own fault.

My goal is to have Pixiv Downloader in one folder, but downloading files into another, distant, folder named !Artist, on the same partition.  Until recently this worked, and I can't figure out what changed.  I'm using version 20161231.

PxivUtil.exe is in  `I:\Rip\ani\Tools\pixivutil`, and here is my rootdirectory as set in config:

`rootdirectory = I:\Rip\ani\CG\!Artist\`

I'd like Pixiv to save all artists from list.txt to that location.  However, if I use `1234 .\Rainbows` in list, it dumps it in pixiv.  And if I use `1234 %root%\Rainbows`,  it dumps it in I:\Rainbows.

How can I configure it to put it in "I:\Rip\ani\CG\!Artist\Rainbows\1234" short of using the full path every time?

Filename in case it's relevant:

```
filenameformat = %artist% (%member_id%)\%urlFilename% - %title%
filenamemangaformat = %artist% (%member_id%)\%urlFilename% - %title%
```
Thanks for the help.

title: Allow local files with different sizes than the server
body:
I realize that most people like to maintain the integrity of downloaded images, and that's fine. But this is something that has been troubling me since the program came out, so I'd ask for at least a quick consideration ;)

I have well over a million images. As I browse through (rather quickly sometimes) in XnViewMP, I mark them with the star and color systems to denote quality and general usefulness. Now, this data can be saved externally for each image, or internally to the XnView database. But saving it to the image it self is instant, cannot be lost, and does not alter the quality of the picture.
#### Therefore, I would dearly love to see what strikes me as a very simple option: _do not overwrite the image if the _filename_ already exists in the folder_.

Which is to say: do not check the database, do not check the file size, or the checksum. If the file exists as named, implement a simple option to assume it is complete, and leave it alone.

The program has a series of options that might appear to cover this: `overwrite`, `alwaysCheckFileSize`, and `backupOldFile.` My surmise is that these were intended for use when the DB was not available, or an artist altered one of their uploads.

But this brings me to the option **`checkUpdatedLimit`**. The suggestion is if that in an existing directory with images, the program downloads and overwrites X number of images that match the database Once satisfied these files match the server's, it will proceed to the next artist/folder. _However, I have noted the exact opposite behavior_. When no database is present (or doesn't include the current artist), the program will proceed as normal through the entire directory, even if the requisite number of consecutively "perfect" images are found.Not only does this overwrite my changes, but wastes server time.

**`alwaysCheckFileSize`** frequently checks all or most file sizes even if turned off, as well.

Even if it makes sense to you and many others to insist on unaltered copies, I would beg for the seeming simple and time-saving option I suggested, whereby the filename is the final word in whether to download or no. If I'm combining these options wrong and what I'm asking for is somehow possible, you can be certainly I would humbly like to learn how this could work.

Thank you so much for this amazing program <3

title: [Bug] Raising ValueError when meeting "corrupt" uploads (empty illust_id)
body:
Greetings Nandaka and thanks for your hard work!

Here is a little bug that happens due to the way pixiv now handles corrupt or deleted uploads that still appear but don't link to anything - the GET argument for `illust_id` is empty - resulting in the script grabbing the empty argument, attempting to cast it as an integer and (obviously) failing without a dump:

Traceback:
`Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "pixivutil2.py", line 1688, in main
    np_is_valid, op_is_valid, selection = main_loop(ewd, mode, op_is_valid, selection, np_is_valid,
args)
  File "pixivutil2.py", line 1488, in main_loop
    menu_download_by_tags(mode, op_is_valid, args)
  File "pixivutil2.py", line 1256, in menu_download_by_tags
    use_tags_as_dir=__config__.useTagsAsDir, bookmark_count=bookmark_count)
  File "pixivutil2.py", line 742, in process_tags
    l = t.parseTags(parse_search_page)
  File "PixivModel.py", line 727, in parseTags
    self.itemList.append(PixivTagsItem(int(image_id), int(bookmarkCount), int(imageResponse)))
ValueError: invalid literal for int() with base 10: ''`

This can be relatively easily reproduced with a tag search. I am fairly new to Python, so I can't really help much.

EDIT: Ignore on `not str(image_id).isdigit()` does the job perfectly. Thank you for the fix!

Cheers and please keep it up!
~ Lily

title: Crash caused by Pixiv's new animated images feature
body:
As of June 25th 2014, Pixiv has introduced a new function that allows animations, as announced here: http://www.pixiv.net/info.php?id=2476. 

The software cannot obviously process the new format, since these images cannot be even saved normally: they are played by a Java applet. So every time the software reaches an image_id that uses it, it shuts down immediately. Within hours, several artists have already started to use the new feature, so option 8 has become unusable, and it’ll extend to other functions once use of the new feature spreads.

A solution, or at least a temporary one, may be have the software skip the image_id once it finds there is no “traditional” image.

Also, by taking a look into the page source of some new images, they seem to lead to zip files that contain their individual animation frames.

For example, for
http://www.pixiv.net/member_illust.php?mode=medium&illust_id=44301046

I find
{“src”:”http:\/\/i1.pixiv.net\/img-zip-ugoira\/img\/2014\/06\/25\/17\/58\/59\/44301046_ugoira600x600.zip”
“src”:”http:\/\/i1.pixiv.net\/img-zip-ugoira\/img\/2014\/06\/25\/17\/58\/59\/44301046_ugoira1920x1080.zip”
(I took only these and not the commands that follow, regulating the delay of each individual frame)

Baside skipping, managing to get these may be the “key”.
